titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The SS Philadelphia was built by William Cramp and Sons, Philadelphia. It was run by the Red D Line and transported passengers, goods, and mail between New York and Venezuela, stopping at various ports in between. Passenger services operated between New York, San Juan, Curacao, La Guaira and Puerto Cabello and returned to New York via Curacao and San Juan.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of three logbooks of the SS Philadelphia, 1891-1893, 1900-1901, and 1902. The logbooks describe journeys from New York to Venezuela, noting weather, loading and unloading of cargo and passengers, customs activities, and sightings and interactions with other vessels. One volume includes several newspaper clippings (humorous, political, and shipping-related). Two of the volumes number the voyages: 171-179 and 193-195.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Calvin Hobbs
